704524f-a.text:
Fulton Street, east from and across Flatbush Avenue Extension, underneath the B. M. T. elevated. The four-story building (center) is the Witteman Building and is on the east side of Flatbush Avenue Extension.
P. L. Sperr

View 1: April 27, 1940
View 2: June 21, 1941
View 3: July 14, 1941
View 2 shows the "El" being dismantled.
View 3: The "El" is gone.

view 2: Neg.No.A-1048

Flatbush Ave. Extension adjoining n.e. corner of Fulton

July 14,  1941

704179f-a.text:
Flatbush Avenue, at Fulton Street, looking south, showing the old Fox Theater Building being razed. The new Fox is on the left.
P. L. Sperr  August 20, 1941
Views 1, 2
704179f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY

704179f-b.text:
Flatbush Avenue, at Fulton Street, looking south, showing the old Fox Theater Building being razed. The new Fox is on the left.
P. L. Sperr  August 20, 1941
Views 1, 2
704179f-b.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY

704180f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave. (foreground), east side, south from the intersection of Fulton Street and Flatbush Ave. The Fulton Street Elevated line of the B.M.T. is shown winding its way eastward on Fulton Street. In the background colonnaded is the Masonic Temple located at Lafayette and Clermont Aves. The Myrtle Ave. Line is on Flatbush Ave. (foreground). This view also shows a general view eastward.
August 12, 1929.
704180f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY

704525f-a.text:
S.E. corner of Fulton St. & Flatbush Ave., Bklyn.
May 13, 1942
P.L. Sperr, photographer
704525f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

705946f-a.text:
Nevins Street, south from Flatbush Ave. Also Flatbush Ave., west side, east from Nevins Street. This view is no longer existent. The buildings were razed, to make way for the new Fox Theatreg a motion picture house.
June 1926.
Brown Brothors.
705946f-a.folder: Nevins Street & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
